page.title: 18W' HEATH CHURH & PUB
page.content: The{C of E Christ Church}was built in 1841 to accommodate 230 people.It was originally a{Chapel of Ease}linked to Ledbury. Burned down in 1944, it was rebuilt using the same walls, by 1952. Opposite there is a{local cemetry}Once a week the{Rector of Bosbury}presides. The Pub at Hope End closed years ago. The remaining Pub,{The Farmers Arms, is in the centre of the village and is very{well patronised,}the ensuing {heavy traffic causing concern}to the residents. Built over 200 years ago of local stone, it was not much more than a{cider counter}for the locals, with chickens running free in the straw on the floor. Over the last 15 years it has been{renovated and extended,}and with an increase of tourism in the area, it is well patronised by walkers visitors and regulars, who come to enjoy the{excelllent food}offered.
